44015004	When they arrived in Jerusalem , they were welcomed by the apostles , the elders , and the church . Paul , Barnabas , and the others told about everything God had done with them .
44015005	But some of the believers who belonged to the Pharisee group came forward and said , “ The non-Jewish believers must be circumcised . They must be told to obey the law of Moses . ”
44015006	The apostles and the elders gathered to consider this problem .
44015007	After a long debate , Peter stood up and said to them , “ Brothers , you know that in the early days God chose me from among you to preach the Good News to the nations . They heard the Good News from me , and they believed .
44015008	God , who knows the thoughts of everyone , accepted them . He showed this to us by giving them the Holy Spirit , just as he did to us .
44015009	To God , those people are not different from us . When they believed , he made their hearts pure .
44015010	So now why are you testing God by putting a heavy load around the necks of the non-Jewish believers ? It is a load that neither we nor our ancestors were able to carry .
44015011	But we believe that we and they too will be saved by the grace of the Lord Jesus . ”
44015012	Then the whole group became quiet . They listened to Paul and Barnabas tell about all the miracles and signs that God did through them among the people .
44015013	After they finished speaking , James said , “ Brothers , listen to me .
44015014	Simon has told us how God showed his love for those people . For the first time he is accepting from among them a people to be his own .
44015015	The words of the prophets agree with this too :
44015016	‘ After these things I will return . The kingdom of David is like a fallen tent . But I will rebuild its ruins , and I will set it up .
44015017	Then those people who are left alive may ask the Lord for help , and the other nations that belong to me , says the Lord , who will make it happen .
44015018	And these things have been known for a long time . ’
44015019	“ So I think we should not bother the other people who are turning to God .
44015020	Instead , we should write a letter to them telling them these things : Stay away from food that has been offered to idols ( which makes it unclean ) , any kind of sexual sin , eating animals that have been strangled , and blood .
44015021	They should do these things , because for a long time in every city the law of Moses has been taught . And it is still read in the synagogue every Sabbath day . ”
44015022	The apostles , the elders , and the whole church decided to send some of their men with Paul and Barnabas to Antioch . They chose Judas Barsabbas and Silas , who were respected by the believers .
44015023	They sent the following letter with them : From the apostles and elders , your brothers . To all the non-Jewish believers in Antioch , Syria , and Cilicia : Greetings !
44015024	We have heard that some of our group have come to you and said things that trouble and upset you . But we did not tell them to do this .
44015025	We have all agreed to choose some messengers and send them to you with our dear friends Barnabas and Paul —
44015026	people who have given their lives to serve our Lord Jesus Christ .
44015027	So we are sending Judas and Silas , who will tell you the same things .
44015028	It has pleased the Holy Spirit that you should not have a heavy load to carry , and we agree . You need to do only these things :
44015029	Stay away from any food that has been offered to idols , eating any animals that have been strangled , and blood , and any kind of sexual sin . If you stay away from these things , you will do well . Good-bye .
44015030	So they left Jerusalem and went to Antioch where they gathered the church and gave them the letter .
44015031	When they read it , they were very happy because of the encouraging message .
44015032	Judas and Silas , who were also prophets , said many things to encourage the believers and make them stronger .
44015033	After some time Judas and Silas were sent off in peace by the believers , and they went back to those who had sent them [ ,
44015034	but Silas decided to remain there ] .
44015035	But Paul and Barnabas stayed in Antioch and , along with many others , preached the Good News and taught the people the message of the Lord .
44015036	After some time , Paul said to Barnabas , “ We should go back to all those towns where we preached the message of the Lord . Let’s visit the believers and see how they are doing . ”
44015037	Barnabas wanted to take John Mark with them ,
44015038	but he had left them at Pamphylia ; he did not continue with them in the work . So Paul did not think it was a good idea to take him .
44015039	Paul and Barnabas had such a serious argument about this that they separated and went different ways . Barnabas took Mark and sailed to Cyprus ,
44015040	but Paul chose Silas and left . The believers in Antioch put Paul into the Lord’s care ,
44015041	and he went through Syria and Cilicia , giving strength to the churches .
44016001	Paul came to Derbe and Lystra , where a follower named Timothy lived . Timothy’s mother was Jewish and a believer , but his father was a Greek .
44016002	The believers in Lystra and Iconium respected Timothy and said good things about him .
44016003	Paul wanted Timothy to travel with him , but all the people living in that area knew that Timothy’s father was Greek . So Paul circumcised Timothy to please his mother’s people .
44016004	Paul and those with him traveled from town to town and gave the decisions made by the apostles and elders in Jerusalem for the people to obey .
44016005	So the churches became stronger in the faith and grew larger every day .
44016006	Paul and those with him went through the areas of Phrygia and Galatia since the Holy Spirit did not let them preach the Good News in Asia .
44016007	When they came near the country of Mysia , they tried to go into Bithynia , but the Spirit of Jesus did not let them .
44016008	So they passed by Mysia and went to Troas .
44016009	That night Paul saw in a vision a man from Macedonia . The man stood and begged , “ Come over to Macedonia and help us . ”
44016010	After Paul had seen the vision , we immediately prepared to leave for Macedonia , understanding that God had called us to tell the Good News to those people .
44016011	We left Troas and sailed straight to the island of Samothrace . The next day we sailed to Neapolis .
44016012	Then we went by land to Philippi , a Roman colony and the leading city in that part of Macedonia . We stayed there for several days .
44016013	On the Sabbath day we went outside the city gate to the river where we thought we would find a special place for prayer . Some women had gathered there , so we sat down and talked with them .
44016014	One of the listeners was a woman named Lydia from the city of Thyatira whose job was selling purple cloth . She worshiped God , and he opened her mind to pay attention to what Paul was saying .
44016015	She and all the people in her house were baptized . Then she invited us to her home , saying , “ If you think I am truly a believer in the Lord , then come stay in my house . ” And she persuaded us to stay with her .
44016016	Once , while we were going to the place for prayer , a servant girl met us . She had a special spirit in her , and she earned a lot of money for her owners by telling fortunes .
44016017	This girl followed Paul and us , shouting , “ These men are servants of the Most High God . They are telling you how you can be saved . ”
44016018	She kept this up for many days . This bothered Paul , so he turned and said to the spirit , “ By the power of Jesus Christ , I command you to come out of her ! ” Immediately , the spirit came out .
44016019	When the owners of the servant girl saw this , they knew that now they could not use her to make money . So they grabbed Paul and Silas and dragged them before the city rulers in the marketplace .
44016020	They brought Paul and Silas to the Roman rulers and said , “ These men are Jews and are making trouble in our city .
44016021	They are teaching things that are not right for us as Romans to do . ”
44016022	The crowd joined the attack against them . The Roman officers tore the clothes of Paul and Silas and had them beaten with rods .
44016023	Then Paul and Silas were thrown into jail , and the jailer was ordered to guard them carefully .
44016024	When he heard this order , he put them far inside the jail and pinned their feet down between large blocks of wood .
44016025	About midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing songs to God as the other prisoners listened .
44016026	Suddenly , there was a strong earthquake that shook the foundation of the jail . Then all the doors of the jail broke open , and all the prisoners were freed from their chains .
44016027	The jailer woke up and saw that the jail doors were open . Thinking that the prisoners had already escaped , he got his sword and was about to kill himself .
44016028	But Paul shouted , “ Don’t hurt yourself ! We are all here . ”
44016029	The jailer told someone to bring a light . Then he ran inside and , shaking with fear , fell down before Paul and Silas .
44016030	He brought them outside and said , “ Men , what must I do to be saved ? ”
44016031	They said to him , “ Believe in the Lord Jesus and you will be saved — you and all the people in your house . ”
44016032	So Paul and Silas told the message of the Lord to the jailer and all the people in his house .
44016033	At that hour of the night the jailer took Paul and Silas and washed their wounds . Then he and all his people were baptized immediately .
44016034	After this the jailer took Paul and Silas home and gave them food . He and his family were very happy because they now believed in God .
44016035	The next morning , the Roman officers sent the police to tell the jailer , “ Let these men go free . ”
44016036	The jailer said to Paul , “ The officers have sent an order to let you go free . You can leave now . Go in peace . ”
44016037	But Paul said to the police , “ They beat us in public without a trial , even though we are Roman citizens . And they threw us in jail . Now they want to make us go away quietly . No ! Let them come themselves and bring us out . ”
44016038	The police told the Roman officers what Paul said . When the officers heard that Paul and Silas were Roman citizens , they were afraid .
44016039	So they came and told Paul and Silas they were sorry and took them out of jail and asked them to leave the city .
44016040	So when they came out of the jail , they went to Lydia’s house where they saw some of the believers and encouraged them . Then they left .
44017001	Paul and Silas traveled through Amphipolis and Apollonia and came to Thessalonica where there was a synagogue .
44017002	Paul went into the synagogue as he always did , and on each Sabbath day for three weeks , he talked with his fellow Jews about the Scriptures .
44017003	He explained and proved that the Christ must die and then rise from the dead . He said , “ This Jesus I am telling you about is the Christ . ”
44017004	Some of them were convinced and joined Paul and Silas , along with many of the Greeks who worshiped God and many of the important women .
44017005	But some others became jealous . So they got some evil men from the marketplace , formed a mob , and started a riot . They ran to Jason’s house , looking for Paul and Silas , wanting to bring them out to the people .
44017006	But when they did not find them , they dragged Jason and some other believers to the leaders of the city . The people were yelling , “ These people have made trouble everywhere in the world , and now they have come here too !
44017007	Jason is keeping them in his house . All of them do things against the laws of Caesar , saying there is another king , called Jesus . ”
44017008	When the people and the leaders of the city heard these things , they became very upset .
44017009	They made Jason and the others put up a sum of money . Then they let the believers go free .
44017010	That same night the believers sent Paul and Silas to Berea where they went to the synagogue .
44017011	These people were more willing to listen than the people in Thessalonica . The Bereans were eager to hear what Paul and Silas said and studied the Scriptures every day to find out if these things were true .
44017012	So , many of them believed , as well as many important Greek women and men .
44017013	But the people in Thessalonica learned that Paul was preaching the word of God in Berea , too . So they came there , upsetting the people and making trouble .
44017014	The believers quickly sent Paul away to the coast , but Silas and Timothy stayed in Berea .
44017015	The people leading Paul went with him to Athens . Then they carried a message from Paul back to Silas and Timothy for them to come to him as soon as they could .
44017016	While Paul was waiting for Silas and Timothy in Athens , he was troubled because he saw that the city was full of idols .
44017017	In the synagogue , he talked with the Jews and the Greeks who worshiped God . He also talked every day with people in the marketplace .
44017018	Some of the Epicurean and Stoic philosophers argued with him , saying , “ This man doesn’t know what he is talking about . What is he trying to say ? ” Others said , “ He seems to be telling us about some other gods , ” because Paul was telling them about Jesus and his rising from the dead .
44017019	They got Paul and took him to a meeting of the Areopagus , where they said , “ Please explain to us this new idea you have been teaching .
44017020	The things you are saying are new to us , and we want to know what this teaching means . ”
44017021	( All the people of Athens and those from other countries who lived there always used their time to talk about the newest ideas . )
44017022	Then Paul stood before the meeting of the Areopagus and said , “ People of Athens , I can see you are very religious in all things .
44017023	As I was going through your city , I saw the objects you worship . I found an altar that had these words written on it : to a god who is not known . You worship a god that you don’t know , and this is the God I am telling you about !
44017024	The God who made the whole world and everything in it is the Lord of the land and the sky . He does not live in temples built by human hands .
44017025	This God is the One who gives life , breath , and everything else to people . He does not need any help from them ; he has everything he needs .
44017026	God began by making one person , and from him came all the different people who live everywhere in the world . God decided exactly when and where they must live .
44017027	God wanted them to look for him and perhaps search all around for him and find him , though he is not far from any of us :
44017028	‘ By his power we live and move and exist . ’ Some of your own poets have said : ‘ For we are his children . ’
44017029	Since we are God’s children , you must not think that God is like something that people imagine or make from gold , silver , or rock .
44017030	In the past , people did not understand God , and he ignored this . But now , God tells all people in the world to change their hearts and lives .
44017031	God has set a day that he will judge all the world with fairness , by the man he chose long ago . And God has proved this to everyone by raising that man from the dead ! ”
44017032	When the people heard about Jesus being raised from the dead , some of them laughed . But others said , “ We will hear more about this from you later . ”
44017033	So Paul went away from them .
44017034	But some of the people believed Paul and joined him . Among those who believed was Dionysius , a member of the Areopagus , a woman named Damaris , and some others .
44018001	Later Paul left Athens and went to Corinth .
44018002	Here he met a Jew named Aquila who had been born in the country of Pontus . But Aquila and his wife , Priscilla , had recently moved to Corinth from Italy , because Claudius commanded that all Jews must leave Rome . Paul went to visit Aquila and Priscilla .
44018003	Because they were tentmakers , just as he was , he stayed with them and worked with them .
44018004	Every Sabbath day he talked with the Jews and Greeks in the synagogue , trying to persuade them to believe in Jesus .
44018005	Silas and Timothy came from Macedonia and joined Paul in Corinth . After this , Paul spent all his time telling people the Good News , showing them that Jesus is the Christ .
44018006	But they would not accept Paul’s teaching and said some evil things . So he shook off the dust from his clothes and said to them , “ If you are not saved , it will be your own fault ! I have done all I can do ! After this , I will go to other nations . ”
44018007	Paul left the synagogue and moved into the home of Titius Justus , next to the synagogue . This man worshiped God .
44018008	Crispus was the leader of that synagogue , and he and all the people living in his house believed in the Lord . Many others in Corinth also listened to Paul and believed and were baptized .
44018009	During the night , the Lord told Paul in a vision : “ Don’t be afraid . Continue talking to people and don’t be quiet .
44018010	I am with you , and no one will hurt you because many of my people are in this city . ”
44018011	Paul stayed there for a year and a half , teaching God’s word to the people .
44018012	When Gallio was the governor of the country of Southern Greece , some people came together against Paul and took him to the court .
44018013	They said , “ This man is teaching people to worship God in a way that is against our law . ”
44018014	Paul was about to say something , but Gallio spoke , saying , “ I would listen to you if you were complaining about a crime or some wrong .
44018015	But the things you are saying are only questions about words and names — arguments about your own law . So you must solve this problem yourselves . I don’t want to be a judge of these things . ”
44018016	And Gallio made them leave the court .
44018017	Then they all grabbed Sosthenes , the leader of the synagogue , and beat him there before the court . But this did not bother Gallio .
44018018	Paul stayed with the believers for many more days . Then he left and sailed for Syria , with Priscilla and Aquila . At Cenchrea Paul cut off his hair , because he had made a promise to God .
44018019	Then they went to Ephesus , where Paul left Priscilla and Aquila . While Paul was there , he went into the synagogue and talked with the people .
44018020	When they asked him to stay with them longer , he refused .
44018021	But as he left , he said , “ I will come back to you again if God wants me to . ” And so he sailed away from Ephesus .
44018022	When Paul landed at Caesarea , he went and gave greetings to the church in Jerusalem . After that , Paul went to Antioch .
44018023	He stayed there for a while and then left and went through the regions of Galatia and Phrygia . He traveled from town to town in these regions , giving strength to all the followers .
44018024	A Jew named Apollos came to Ephesus . He was born in the city of Alexandria and was a good speaker who knew the Scriptures well .
44018025	He had been taught about the way of the Lord and was always very excited when he spoke and taught the truth about Jesus . But the only baptism Apollos knew about was the baptism that John taught .
44018026	Apollos began to speak very boldly in the synagogue , and when Priscilla and Aquila heard him , they took him to their home and helped him better understand the way of God .
44018027	Now Apollos wanted to go to the country of Southern Greece . So the believers helped him and wrote a letter to the followers there , asking them to accept him . These followers had believed in Jesus because of God’s grace , and when Apollos arrived , he helped them very much .
44018028	He argued very strongly with the Jews before all the people , clearly proving with the Scriptures that Jesus is the Christ .
44019001	While Apollos was in Corinth , Paul was visiting some places on the way to Ephesus . There he found some followers
44019002	and asked them , “ Did you receive the Holy Spirit when you believed ? ” They said , “ We have never even heard of a Holy Spirit . ”
44019003	So he asked , “ What kind of baptism did you have ? ” They said , “ It was the baptism that John taught . ”
44019004	Paul said , “ John’s baptism was a baptism of changed hearts and lives . He told people to believe in the one who would come after him , and that one is Jesus . ”
44019005	When they heard this , they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus .
44019006	Then Paul laid his hands on them , and the Holy Spirit came upon them . They began speaking different languages and prophesying .
44019007	There were about twelve people in this group .
44019008	Paul went into the synagogue and spoke out boldly for three months . He talked with the people and persuaded them to accept the things he said about the kingdom of God .
44019009	But some of them became stubborn . They refused to believe and said evil things about the Way of Jesus before all the people . So Paul left them , and taking the followers with him , he went to the school of a man named Tyrannus . There Paul talked with people every day
44019010	for two years . Because of his work , every Jew and Greek in Asia heard the word of the Lord .
44019011	God used Paul to do some very special miracles .
44019012	Some people took handkerchiefs and clothes that Paul had used and put them on the sick . When they did this , the sick were healed and evil spirits left them .
44019013	But some people also were traveling around and making evil spirits go out of people . They tried to use the name of the Lord Jesus to force the evil spirits out . They would say , “ By the same Jesus that Paul talks about , I order you to come out ! ”
44019014	Seven sons of Sceva , a leading priest , were doing this .
44019015	But one time an evil spirit said to them , “ I know Jesus , and I know about Paul , but who are you ? ”
44019016	Then the man who had the evil spirit jumped on them . Because he was so much stronger than all of them , they ran away from the house naked and hurt .
44019017	All the people in Ephesus — Jews and Greeks — learned about this and were filled with fear and gave great honor to the Lord Jesus .
44019018	Many of the believers began to confess openly and tell all the evil things they had done .
44019019	Some of them who had used magic brought their magic books and burned them before everyone . Those books were worth about fifty thousand silver coins .
44019020	So in a powerful way the word of the Lord kept spreading and growing .
44019021	After these things , Paul decided to go to Jerusalem , planning to go through the countries of Macedonia and Southern Greece and then on to Jerusalem . He said , “ After I have been to Jerusalem , I must also visit Rome . ”
44019022	Paul sent Timothy and Erastus , two of his helpers , ahead to Macedonia , but he himself stayed in Asia for a while .
44019023	And during that time , there was some serious trouble in Ephesus about the Way of Jesus .
44019024	A man named Demetrius , who worked with silver , made little silver models that looked like the temple of the goddess Artemis . Those who did this work made much money .
44019025	Demetrius had a meeting with them and some others who did the same kind of work . He told them , “ Men , you know that we make a lot of money from our business .
44019026	But look at what this man Paul is doing . He has convinced and turned away many people in Ephesus and in almost all of Asia ! He says the gods made by human hands are not real .
44019027	There is a danger that our business will lose its good name , but there is also another danger : People will begin to think that the temple of the great goddess Artemis is not important . Her greatness will be destroyed , and Artemis is the goddess that everyone in Asia and the whole world worships . ”
44019028	When the others heard this , they became very angry and shouted , “ Artemis , the goddess of Ephesus , is great ! ”
44019029	The whole city became confused . The people grabbed Gaius and Aristarchus , who were from Macedonia and were traveling with Paul , and ran to the theater .
44019030	Paul wanted to go in and talk to the crowd , but the followers did not let him .
44019031	Also , some leaders of Asia who were friends of Paul sent him a message , begging him not to go into the theater .
44019032	Some people were shouting one thing , and some were shouting another . The meeting was completely confused ; most of them did not know why they had come together .
44019033	They put a man named Alexander in front of the people , and some of them told him what to do . Alexander waved his hand so he could explain things to the people .
44019034	But when they saw that Alexander was a Jew , they all shouted the same thing for two hours : “ Great is Artemis of Ephesus ! ”
44019035	Then the city clerk made the crowd be quiet . He said , “ People of Ephesus , everyone knows that Ephesus is the city that keeps the temple of the great goddess Artemis and her holy stone that fell from heaven .
44019036	Since no one can say this is not true , you should be quiet . Stop and think before you do anything .
44019037	You brought these men here , but they have not said anything evil against our goddess or stolen anything from her temple .
44019038	If Demetrius and those who work with him have a charge against anyone they should go to the courts and judges where they can argue with each other .
44019039	If there is something else you want to talk about , it can be decided at the regular town meeting of the people .
44019040	I say this because some people might see this trouble today and say that we are rioting . We could not explain this , because there is no real reason for this meeting . ”
44019041	After the city clerk said these things , he told the people to go home .
44020001	When the trouble stopped , Paul sent for the followers to come to him . After he encouraged them and then told them good-bye , he left and went to the country of Macedonia .
44020002	He said many things to strengthen the followers in the different places on his way through Macedonia . Then he went to Greece ,
44020003	where he stayed for three months . He was ready to sail for Syria , but some evil people were planning something against him . So Paul decided to go back through Macedonia to Syria .
44020004	The men who went with him were Sopater son of Pyrrhus , from the city of Berea ; Aristarchus and Secundus , from the city of Thessalonica ; Gaius , from Derbe ; Timothy ; and Tychicus and Trophimus , two men from Asia .
44020005	These men went on ahead and waited for us at Troas .
44020006	We sailed from Philippi after the Feast of Unleavened Bread . Five days later we met them in Troas , where we stayed for seven days .
44020007	On the first day of the week , we all met together to break bread , and Paul spoke to the group . Because he was planning to leave the next day , he kept on talking until midnight .
44020008	We were all together in a room upstairs , and there were many lamps in the room .
44020009	A young man named Eutychus was sitting in the window . As Paul continued talking , Eutychus was falling into a deep sleep . Finally , he went sound asleep and fell to the ground from the third floor . When they picked him up , he was dead .
44020010	Paul went down to Eutychus , knelt down , and put his arms around him . He said , “ Don’t worry . He is alive now . ”
44020011	Then Paul went upstairs again , broke bread , and ate . He spoke to them a long time , until it was early morning , and then he left .
44020012	They took the young man home alive and were greatly comforted .
44020013	We went on ahead of Paul and sailed for the city of Assos , where he wanted to join us on the ship . Paul planned it this way because he wanted to go to Assos by land .
44020014	When he met us there , we took him aboard and went to Mitylene .
44020015	We sailed from Mitylene and the next day came to a place near Kios . The following day we sailed to Samos , and the next day we reached Miletus .
44020016	Paul had already decided not to stop at Ephesus , because he did not want to stay too long in Asia . He was hurrying to be in Jerusalem on the day of Pentecost , if that were possible .
44020017	Now from Miletus Paul sent to Ephesus and called for the elders of the church .
44020018	When they came to him , he said , “ You know about my life from the first day I came to Asia . You know the way I lived all the time I was with you .
44020019	The evil people made plans against me , which troubled me very much . But you know I always served the Lord unselfishly , and I often cried .
44020020	You know I preached to you and did not hold back anything that would help you . You know that I taught you in public and in your homes .
44020021	I warned both Jews and Greeks to change their lives and turn to God and believe in our Lord Jesus .
44020022	But now I must obey the Holy Spirit and go to Jerusalem . I don’t know what will happen to me there .
44020023	I know only that in every city the Holy Spirit tells me that troubles and even jail wait for me .
44020024	I don’t care about my own life . The most important thing is that I complete my mission , the work that the Lord Jesus gave me — to tell people the Good News about God’s grace .
44020025	“ And now , I know that none of you among whom I was preaching the kingdom of God will ever see me again .
44020026	So today I tell you that if any of you should be lost , I am not responsible ,
44020027	because I have told you everything God wants you to know .
44020028	Be careful for yourselves and for all the people the Holy Spirit has given to you to oversee . You must be like shepherds to the church of God , which he bought with the death of his own son .
44020029	I know that after I leave , some people will come like wild wolves and try to destroy the flock .
44020030	Also , some from your own group will rise up and twist the truth and will lead away followers after them .
44020031	So be careful ! Always remember that for three years , day and night , I never stopped warning each of you , and I often cried over you .
44020032	“ Now I am putting you in the care of God and the message about his grace . It is able to give you strength , and it will give you the blessings God has for all his holy people .
44020033	When I was with you , I never wanted anyone’s money or fine clothes .
44020034	You know I always worked to take care of my own needs and the needs of those who were with me .
44020035	I showed you in all things that you should work as I did and help the weak . I taught you to remember the words Jesus said : ‘ It is more blessed to give than to receive . ’ ”
44020036	When Paul had said this , he knelt down with all of them and prayed .
44021001	After we all said good-bye to them , we sailed straight to the island of Cos . The next day we reached Rhodes , and from there we went to Patara .
44021002	There we found a ship going to Phoenicia , so we went aboard and sailed away .
44021003	We sailed near the island of Cyprus , seeing it to the north , but we sailed on to Syria . We stopped at Tyre because the ship needed to unload its cargo there .
44021004	We found some followers in Tyre and stayed with them for seven days . Through the Holy Spirit they warned Paul not to go to Jerusalem .
44021005	When we finished our visit , we left and continued our trip . All the followers , even the women and children , came outside the city with us . After we all knelt on the beach and prayed ,
44021006	we said good-bye and got on the ship , and the followers went back home .
44021007	We continued our trip from Tyre and arrived at Ptolemais , where we greeted the believers and stayed with them for a day .
44021008	The next day we left Ptolemais and went to the city of Caesarea . There we went into the home of Philip the preacher , one of the seven helpers , and stayed with him .
44021009	He had four unmarried daughters who had the gift of prophesying .
44021010	After we had been there for some time , a prophet named Agabus arrived from Judea .
44021011	He came to us and borrowed Paul’s belt and used it to tie his own hands and feet . He said , “ The Holy Spirit says , ‘ This is how evil people in Jerusalem will tie up the man who wears this belt . Then they will give him to the older leaders . ’ ”
44021012	When we all heard this , we and the people there begged Paul not to go to Jerusalem .
44021013	But he said , “ Why are you crying and making me so sad ? I am not only ready to be tied up in Jerusalem , I am ready to die for the Lord Jesus ! ”
44021014	We could not persuade him to stay away from Jerusalem . So we stopped begging him and said , “ We pray that what the Lord wants will be done . ”
44021015	After this , we got ready and started on our way to Jerusalem .
44021016	Some of the followers from Caesarea went with us and took us to the home of Mnason , where we would stay . He was from Cyprus and was one of the first followers .
44021017	In Jerusalem the believers were glad to see us .
44021018	The next day Paul went with us to visit James , and all the elders were there .
44021019	Paul greeted them and told them everything God had done among the other nations through him .
44021020	When they heard this , they praised God . Then they said to Paul , “ Brother , you can see that many thousands of our people have become believers . And they think it is very important to obey the law of Moses .
44021021	They have heard about your teaching , that you tell our people who live among the nations to leave the law of Moses . They have heard that you tell them not to circumcise their children and not to obey customs .
44021022	What should we do ? They will learn that you have come .
44021023	So we will tell you what to do : Four of our men have made a promise to God .
44021024	Take these men with you and share in their cleansing ceremony . Pay their expenses so they can shave their heads . Then it will prove to everyone that what they have heard about you is not true and that you follow the law of Moses in your own life .
44021025	We have already sent a letter to the non-Jewish believers . The letter said : ‘ Do not eat food that has been offered to idols , or blood , or animals that have been strangled . Do not take part in sexual sin . ’ ”
44021026	The next day Paul took the four men and shared in the cleansing ceremony with them . Then he went to the Temple and announced the time when the days of the cleansing ceremony would be finished . On the last day an offering would be given for each of the men .
44021027	When the seven days were almost over , some of his people from Asia saw Paul at the Temple . They caused all the people to be upset and grabbed Paul .
44021028	They shouted , “ People of Israel , help us ! This is the man who goes everywhere teaching against the law of Moses , against our people , and against this Temple . Now he has brought some Greeks into the Temple and has made this holy place unclean ! ”
44021029	( They said this because they had seen Trophimus , a man from Ephesus , with Paul in Jerusalem . They thought that Paul had brought him into the Temple . )
44021030	All the people in Jerusalem became upset . Together they ran , took Paul , and dragged him out of the Temple . The Temple doors were closed immediately .
44021031	While they were trying to kill Paul , the commander of the Roman army in Jerusalem learned that there was trouble in the whole city .
44021032	Immediately he took some officers and soldiers and ran to the place where the crowd was gathered . When the people saw them , they stopped beating Paul .
44021033	The commander went to Paul and arrested him . He told his soldiers to tie Paul with two chains . Then he asked who he was and what he had done wrong .
44021034	Some in the crowd were yelling one thing , and some were yelling another . Because of all this confusion and shouting , the commander could not learn what had happened . So he ordered the soldiers to take Paul to the army building .
44021035	When Paul came to the steps , the soldiers had to carry him because the people were ready to hurt him .
44021036	The whole mob was following them , shouting , “ Kill him ! ”
44021037	As the soldiers were about to take Paul into the army building , he spoke to the commander , “ May I say something to you ? ” The commander said , “ Do you speak Greek ?
44021038	I thought you were the Egyptian who started some trouble against the government not long ago and led four thousand killers out to the desert . ”
44021039	Paul said , “ No , I am a Jew from Tarsus in the country of Cilicia . I am a citizen of that important city . Please , let me speak to the people . ”
44021040	The commander gave permission , so Paul stood on the steps and waved his hand to quiet the people . When there was silence , he spoke to them in the Hebrew language .
44022001	Paul said , “ Brothers and fathers , listen to my defense to you . ”
44022002	When they heard him speaking the Hebrew language , they became very quiet . Paul said ,
44022003	“ I am a Jew , born in Tarsus in the country of Cilicia , but I grew up in this city . I was a student of Gamaliel , who carefully taught me everything about the law of our ancestors . I was very serious about serving God , just as are all of you here today .
44022004	I persecuted the people who followed the Way of Jesus , and some of them were even killed . I arrested men and women and put them in jail .
44022005	The high priest and the whole council of elders can tell you this is true . They gave me letters to the brothers in Damascus . So I was going there to arrest these people and bring them back to Jerusalem to be punished .
44022006	“ About noon when I came near Damascus , a bright light from heaven suddenly flashed all around me .
44022007	I fell to the ground and heard a voice saying , ‘ Saul , Saul , why are you persecuting me ? ’
44022008	I asked , ‘ Who are you , Lord ? ’ The voice said , ‘ I am Jesus from Nazareth whom you are persecuting . ’
44022009	Those who were with me did not understand the voice , but they saw the light .
44022010	I said , ‘ What shall I do , Lord ? ’ The Lord answered , ‘ Get up and go to Damascus . There you will be told about all the things I have planned for you to do . ’
44022011	I could not see , because the bright light had made me blind . So my companions led me into Damascus .
44022012	“ There a man named Ananias came to me . He was a religious man ; he obeyed the law of Moses , and all the Jews who lived there respected him .
44022013	He stood by me and said , ‘ Brother Saul , see again ! ’ Immediately I was able to see him .
44022014	He said , ‘ The God of our ancestors chose you long ago to know his plan , to see the Righteous One , and to hear words from him .
44022015	You will be his witness to all people , telling them about what you have seen and heard .
44022016	Now , why wait any longer ? Get up , be baptized , and wash your sins away , trusting in him to save you . ’
44022017	“ Later , when I returned to Jerusalem , I was praying in the Temple , and I saw a vision .
44022018	I saw the Lord saying to me , ‘ Hurry ! Leave Jerusalem now ! The people here will not accept the truth about me . ’
44022019	But I said , ‘ Lord , they know that in every synagogue I put the believers in jail and beat them .
44022020	They also know I was there when Stephen , your witness , was killed . I stood there agreeing and holding the coats of those who were killing him ! ’
44022021	But the Lord said to me , ‘ Leave now . I will send you far away to the other nations . ’ ”
44022022	The crowd listened to Paul until he said this . Then they began shouting , “ Get rid of him ! He doesn’t deserve to live ! ”
44022023	They shouted , threw off their coats , and threw dust into the air .
44022024	Then the commander ordered the soldiers to take Paul into the army building and beat him . He wanted to make Paul tell why the people were shouting against him like this .
44022025	But as the soldiers were tying him up , preparing to beat him , Paul said to an officer nearby , “ Do you have the right to beat a Roman citizen who has not been proven guilty ? ”
44022026	When the officer heard this , he went to the commander and reported it . The officer said , “ Do you know what you are doing ? This man is a Roman citizen . ”
44022027	The commander came to Paul and said , “ Tell me , are you really a Roman citizen ? ” He answered , “ Yes . ”
44022028	The commander said , “ I paid a lot of money to become a Roman citizen . ” But Paul said , “ I was born a citizen . ”
44022029	The men who were preparing to question Paul moved away from him immediately . The commander was frightened because he had already tied Paul , and Paul was a Roman citizen .
44022030	The next day the commander decided to learn why the Jews were accusing Paul . So he ordered the leading priests and the council to meet . The commander took Paul’s chains off . Then he brought Paul out and stood him before their meeting .
44023001	Paul looked at the council and said , “ Brothers , I have lived my life without guilt feelings before God up to this day . ”
44023002	Ananias , the high priest , heard this and told the men who were standing near Paul to hit him on the mouth .
44023003	Paul said to Ananias , “ God will hit you , too ! You are like a wall that has been painted white . You sit there and judge me , using the law of Moses , but you are telling them to hit me , and that is against the law . ”
44023004	The men standing near Paul said to him , “ You cannot insult God’s high priest like that ! ”
44023005	Paul said , “ Brothers , I did not know this man was the high priest . It is written in the Scriptures , ‘ You must not curse a leader of your people . ’ ”
44023006	Some of the men in the meeting were Sadducees , and others were Pharisees . Knowing this , Paul shouted to them , “ My brothers , I am a Pharisee , and my father was a Pharisee . I am on trial here because I believe that people will rise from the dead . ”
44023007	When Paul said this , there was an argument between the Pharisees and the Sadducees , and the group was divided .
44023008	( The Sadducees do not believe in angels or spirits or that people will rise from the dead . But the Pharisees believe in them all . )
44023009	So there was a great uproar . Some of the teachers of the law , who were Pharisees , stood up and argued , “ We find nothing wrong with this man . Maybe an angel or a spirit did speak to him . ”
44023010	The argument was beginning to turn into such a fight that the commander was afraid some evil people would tear Paul to pieces . So he told the soldiers to go down and take Paul away and put him in the army building .
44023011	The next night the Lord came and stood by Paul . He said , “ Be brave ! You have told people in Jerusalem about me . You must do the same in Rome . ”
44023012	In the morning some evil people made a plan to kill Paul , and they took an oath not to eat or drink anything until they had killed him .
44023013	There were more than forty men who made this plan .
44023014	They went to the leading priests and the elders and said , “ We have taken an oath not to eat or drink until we have killed Paul .
44023015	So this is what we want you to do : Send a message to the commander to bring Paul out to you as though you want to ask him more questions . We will be waiting to kill him while he is on the way here . ”
44023016	But Paul’s nephew heard about this plan and went to the army building and told Paul .
44023017	Then Paul called one of the officers and said , “ Take this young man to the commander . He has a message for him . ”
44023018	So the officer brought Paul’s nephew to the commander and said , “ The prisoner , Paul , asked me to bring this young man to you . He wants to tell you something . ”
44023019	The commander took the young man’s hand and led him to a place where they could be alone . He asked , “ What do you want to tell me ? ”
44023020	The young man said , “ The Jews have decided to ask you to bring Paul down to their council meeting tomorrow . They want you to think they are going to ask him more questions .
44023021	But don’t believe them ! More than forty men are hiding and waiting to kill Paul . They have all taken an oath not to eat or drink until they have killed him . Now they are waiting for you to agree . ”
44023022	The commander sent the young man away , ordering him , “ Don’t tell anyone that you have told me about their plan . ”
44023023	Then the commander called two officers and said , “ I need some men to go to Caesarea . Get two hundred soldiers , seventy horsemen , and two hundred men with spears ready to leave at nine o’clock tonight .
44023024	Get some horses for Paul to ride so he can be taken to Governor Felix safely . ”
44023025	And he wrote a letter that said :
44023026	From Claudius Lysias . To the Most Excellent Governor Felix : Greetings .
44023027	Some of the Jews had taken this man and planned to kill him . But I learned that he is a Roman citizen , so I went with my soldiers and saved him .
44023028	I wanted to know why they were accusing him , so I brought him before their council meeting .
44023029	I learned that these people said Paul did some things that were wrong by their own laws , but no charge was worthy of jail or death .
44023030	When I was told that some of them were planning to kill Paul , I sent him to you at once . I also told them to tell you what they have against him .
44023031	So the soldiers did what they were told and took Paul and brought him to the city of Antipatris that night .
44023032	The next day the horsemen went with Paul to Caesarea , but the other soldiers went back to the army building in Jerusalem .
44023033	When the horsemen came to Caesarea and gave the letter to the governor , they turned Paul over to him .
44023034	The governor read the letter and asked Paul , “ What area are you from ? ” When he learned that Paul was from Cilicia ,
44023035	he said , “ I will hear your case when those who are against you come here , too . ” Then the governor gave orders for Paul to be kept under guard in Herod’s palace .
44024001	Five days later Ananias , the high priest , went to the city of Caesarea with some of the elders and a lawyer named Tertullus . They had come to make charges against Paul before the governor .
44024002	Paul was called into the meeting , and Tertullus began to accuse him , saying , “ Most Excellent Felix ! Our people enjoy much peace because of you , and many wrong things in our country are being made right through your wise help .
44024003	We accept these things always and in every place , and we are thankful for them .
44024004	But not wanting to take any more of your time , I beg you to be kind and listen to our few words .
44024005	We have found this man to be a troublemaker , stirring up his people everywhere in the world . He is a leader of the Nazarene group .
44024006	Also , he was trying to make the Temple unclean , but we stopped him . [ And we wanted to judge him by our own law .
44024007	But the officer Lysias came and used much force to take him from us .
44024008	And Lysias commanded those who wanted to accuse Paul to come to you . ] By asking him questions yourself , you can decide if all these things are true . ”
44024009	The others agreed and said that all of this was true .
44024010	When the governor made a sign for Paul to speak , Paul said , “ Governor Felix , I know you have been a judge over this nation for a long time . So I am happy to defend myself before you .
44024011	You can learn for yourself that I went to worship in Jerusalem only twelve days ago .
44024012	Those who are accusing me did not find me arguing with anyone in the Temple or stirring up the people in the synagogues or in the city .
44024013	They cannot prove the things they are saying against me now .
44024014	But I will tell you this : I worship the God of our ancestors as a follower of the Way of Jesus . The others say that the Way of Jesus is not the right way . But I believe everything that is taught in the law of Moses and that is written in the books of the Prophets .
44024015	I have the same hope in God that they have — the hope that all people , good and bad , will surely be raised from the dead .
44024016	This is why I always try to do what I believe is right before God and people .
44024017	“ After being away from Jerusalem for several years , I went back to bring money to my people and to offer sacrifices .
44024018	I was doing this when they found me in the Temple . I had finished the cleansing ceremony and had not made any trouble ; no people were gathering around me .
44024019	But there were some people from Asia who should be here , standing before you . If I have really done anything wrong , they are the ones who should accuse me .
44024020	Or ask these people here if they found any wrong in me when I stood before the council in Jerusalem .
44024021	But I did shout one thing when I stood before them : ‘ You are judging me today because I believe that people will rise from the dead ! ’ ”
44024022	Felix already understood much about the Way of Jesus . He stopped the trial and said , “ When commander Lysias comes here , I will decide your case . ”
44024023	Felix told the officer to keep Paul guarded but to give him some freedom and to let his friends bring what he needed .
44024024	After some days Felix came with his wife , Drusilla , who was Jewish , and asked for Paul to be brought to him . He listened to Paul talk about believing in Christ Jesus .
44024025	But Felix became afraid when Paul spoke about living right , self-control , and the time when God will judge the world . He said , “ Go away now . When I have more time , I will call for you . ”
44024026	At the same time Felix hoped that Paul would give him some money , so he often sent for Paul and talked with him .
44024027	But after two years , Felix was replaced by Porcius Festus as governor . But Felix had left Paul in prison to please the Jews .
44025001	Three days after Festus became governor , he went from Caesarea to Jerusalem .
44025002	There the leading priests and the important leaders made charges against Paul before Festus .
44025003	They asked Festus to do them a favor . They wanted him to send Paul back to Jerusalem , because they had a plan to kill him on the way .
44025004	But Festus answered that Paul would be kept in Caesarea and that he himself was returning there soon .
44025005	He said , “ Some of your leaders should go with me . They can accuse the man there in Caesarea , if he has really done something wrong . ”
44025006	Festus stayed in Jerusalem another eight or ten days and then went back to Caesarea . The next day he told the soldiers to bring Paul before him . Festus was seated on the judge’s seat
44025007	when Paul came into the room . The people who had come from Jerusalem stood around him , making serious charges against him , which they could not prove .
44025008	This is what Paul said to defend himself : “ I have done nothing wrong against the law , against the Temple , or against Caesar . ”
44025009	But Festus wanted to please the people . So he asked Paul , “ Do you want to go to Jerusalem for me to judge you there on these charges ? ”
44025010	Paul said , “ I am standing at Caesar’s judgment seat now , where I should be judged . I have done nothing wrong to them ; you know this is true .
44025011	If I have done something wrong and the law says I must die , I do not ask to be saved from death . But if these charges are not true , then no one can give me to them . I want Caesar to hear my case ! ”
44025012	Festus talked about this with his advisers . Then he said , “ You have asked to see Caesar , so you will go to Caesar ! ”
44025013	A few days later King Agrippa and Bernice came to Caesarea to visit Festus .
44025014	They stayed there for some time , and Festus told the king about Paul’s case . Festus said , “ There is a man that Felix left in prison .
44025015	When I went to Jerusalem , the leading priests and the elders there made charges against him , asking me to sentence him to death .
44025016	But I answered , ‘ When a man is accused of a crime , Romans do not hand him over until he has been allowed to face his accusers and defend himself against their charges . ’
44025017	So when these people came here to Caesarea for the trial , I did not waste time . The next day I sat on the judge’s seat and commanded that the man be brought in .
44025018	They stood up and accused him , but not of any serious crime as I thought they would .
44025019	The things they said were about their own religion and about a man named Jesus who died . But Paul said that he is still alive .
44025020	Not knowing how to find out about these questions , I asked Paul , ‘ Do you want to go to Jerusalem and be judged there ? ’
44025021	But he asked to be kept in Caesarea . He wants a decision from the emperor . So I ordered that he be held until I could send him to Caesar . ”
44025022	Agrippa said to Festus , “ I would also like to hear this man myself . ” Festus said , “ Tomorrow you will hear him . ”
44025023	The next day Agrippa and Bernice appeared with great show , acting like very important people . They went into the judgment room with the army leaders and the important men of Caesarea . Then Festus ordered the soldiers to bring Paul in .
44025024	Festus said , “ King Agrippa and all who are gathered here with us , you see this man . All the people , here and in Jerusalem , have complained to me about him , shouting that he should not live any longer .
44025025	When I judged him , I found no reason to order his death . But since he asked to be judged by Caesar , I decided to send him .
44025026	But I have nothing definite to write the emperor about him . So I have brought him before all of you — especially you , King Agrippa . I hope you can question him and give me something to write .
44025027	I think it is foolish to send a prisoner to Caesar without telling what charges are against him . ”
44026001	Agrippa said to Paul , “ You may now speak to defend yourself . ” Then Paul raised his hand and began to speak .
44026002	He said , “ King Agrippa , I am very blessed to stand before you and will answer all the charges the evil people make against me .
44026003	You know so much about all the customs and the things they argue about , so please listen to me patiently .
44026004	“ All my people know about my whole life , how I lived from the beginning in my own country and later in Jerusalem .
44026005	They have known me for a long time . If they want to , they can tell you that I was a good Pharisee . And the Pharisees obey the laws of my tradition more carefully than any other group .
44026006	Now I am on trial because I hope for the promise that God made to our ancestors .
44026007	This is the promise that the twelve tribes of our people hope to receive as they serve God day and night . My king , they have accused me because I hope for this same promise !
44026008	Why do any of you people think it is impossible for God to raise people from the dead ?
44026009	“ I , too , thought I ought to do many things against Jesus from Nazareth .
44026010	And that is what I did in Jerusalem . The leading priests gave me the power to put many of God’s people in jail , and when they were being killed , I agreed it was a good thing .
44026011	In every synagogue , I often punished them and tried to make them speak against Jesus . I was so angry against them I even went to other cities to find them and punish them .
44026012	“ One time the leading priests gave me permission and the power to go to Damascus .
44026013	On the way there , at noon , I saw a light from heaven . It was brighter than the sun and flashed all around me and those who were traveling with me .
44026014	We all fell to the ground . Then I heard a voice speaking to me in the Hebrew language , saying , ‘ Saul , Saul , why are you persecuting me ? You are only hurting yourself by fighting me . ’
44026015	I said , ‘ Who are you , Lord ? ’ The Lord said , ‘ I am Jesus , the one you are persecuting .
44026016	Stand up ! I have chosen you to be my servant and my witness — you will tell people the things that you have seen and the things that I will show you . This is why I have come to you today .
44026017	I will keep you safe from your own people and also from the others . I am sending you to them
44026018	to open their eyes so that they may turn away from darkness to the light , away from the power of Satan and to God . Then their sins can be forgiven , and they can have a place with those people who have been made holy by believing in me . ’
44026019	“ King Agrippa , after I had this vision from heaven , I obeyed it .
44026020	I began telling people that they should change their hearts and lives and turn to God and do things to show they really had changed . I told this first to those in Damascus , then in Jerusalem , and in every part of Judea , and also to the other people .
44026021	This is why the Jews took me and were trying to kill me in the Temple .
44026022	But God has helped me , and so I stand here today , telling all people , small and great , what I have seen . But I am saying only what Moses and the prophets said would happen —
44026023	that the Christ would die , and as the first to rise from the dead , he would bring light to all people . ”
44026024	While Paul was saying these things to defend himself , Festus said loudly , “ Paul , you are out of your mind ! Too much study has driven you crazy ! ”
44026025	Paul said , “ Most excellent Festus , I am not crazy . My words are true and sensible .
44026026	King Agrippa knows about these things , and I can speak freely to him . I know he has heard about all of these things , because they did not happen off in a corner .
44026027	King Agrippa , do you believe what the prophets wrote ? I know you believe . ”
44026028	King Agrippa said to Paul , “ Do you think you can persuade me to become a Christian in such a short time ? ”
44026029	Paul said , “ Whether it is a short or a long time , I pray to God that not only you but every person listening to me today would be saved and be like me — except for these chains I have . ”
44026030	Then King Agrippa , Governor Festus , Bernice , and all the people sitting with them stood up
44026031	and left the room . Talking to each other , they said , “ There is no reason why this man should die or be put in jail . ”
44026032	And Agrippa said to Festus , “ We could let this man go free , but he has asked Caesar to hear his case . ”
44027001	It was decided that we would sail for Italy . An officer named Julius , who served in the emperor’s army , guarded Paul and some other prisoners .
44027002	We got on a ship that was from the city of Adramyttium and was about to sail to different ports in Asia . Aristarchus , a man from the city of Thessalonica in Macedonia , went with us .
44027003	The next day we came to Sidon . Julius was very good to Paul and gave him freedom to go visit his friends , who took care of his needs .
44027004	We left Sidon and sailed close to the island of Cyprus , because the wind was blowing against us .
44027005	We went across the sea by Cilicia and Pamphylia and landed at the city of Myra , in Lycia .
44027006	There the officer found a ship from Alexandria that was going to Italy , so he put us on it .
44027007	We sailed slowly for many days . We had a hard time reaching Cnidus because the wind was blowing against us , and we could not go any farther . So we sailed by the south side of the island of Crete near Salmone .
44027008	Sailing past it was hard . Then we came to a place called Fair Havens , near the city of Lasea .
44027009	We had lost much time , and it was now dangerous to sail , because it was already after the Day of Cleansing . So Paul warned them ,
44027010	“ Men , I can see there will be a lot of trouble on this trip . The ship , the cargo , and even our lives may be lost . ”
44027011	But the captain and the owner of the ship did not agree with Paul , and the officer believed what the captain and owner of the ship said .
44027012	Since that harbor was not a good place for the ship to stay for the winter , most of the men decided that the ship should leave . They hoped we could go to Phoenix and stay there for the winter . Phoenix , a city on the island of Crete , had a harbor which faced southwest and northwest .
44027013	When a good wind began to blow from the south , the men on the ship thought , “ This is the wind we wanted , and now we have it . ” So they pulled up the anchor , and we sailed very close to the island of Crete .
44027014	But then a very strong wind named the “ northeaster ” came from the island .
44027015	The ship was caught in it and could not sail against it . So we stopped trying and let the wind carry us .
44027016	When we went below a small island named Cauda , we were barely able to bring in the lifeboat .
44027017	After the men took the lifeboat in , they tied ropes around the ship to hold it together . The men were afraid that the ship would hit the sandbanks of Syrtis , so they lowered the sail and let the wind carry the ship .
44027018	The next day the storm was blowing us so hard that the men threw out some of the cargo .
44027019	A day later with their own hands they threw out the ship’s equipment .
44027020	When we could not see the sun or the stars for many days , and the storm was very bad , we lost all hope of being saved .
44027021	After the men had gone without food for a long time , Paul stood up before them and said , “ Men , you should have listened to me . You should not have sailed from Crete . Then you would not have all this trouble and loss .
44027022	But now I tell you to cheer up because none of you will die . Only the ship will be lost .
44027023	Last night an angel came to me from the God I belong to and worship .
44027024	The angel said , ‘ Paul , do not be afraid . You must stand before Caesar . And God has promised you that he will save the lives of everyone sailing with you . ’
44027025	So men , have courage . I trust in God that everything will happen as his angel told me .
44027026	But we will crash on an island . ”
44027027	On the fourteenth night we were still being carried around in the Adriatic Sea . About midnight the sailors thought we were close to land ,
44027028	so they lowered a rope with a weight on the end of it into the water . They found that the water was one hundred twenty feet deep . They went a little farther and lowered the rope again . It was ninety feet deep .
44027029	The sailors were afraid that we would hit the rocks , so they threw four anchors into the water and prayed for daylight to come .
44027030	Some of the sailors wanted to leave the ship , and they lowered the lifeboat , pretending they were throwing more anchors from the front of the ship .
44027031	But Paul told the officer and the other soldiers , “ If these men do not stay in the ship , your lives cannot be saved . ”
44027032	So the soldiers cut the ropes and let the lifeboat fall into the water .
44027033	Just before dawn Paul began persuading all the people to eat something . He said , “ For the past fourteen days you have been waiting and watching and not eating .
44027034	Now I beg you to eat something . You need it to stay alive . None of you will lose even one hair off your heads . ”
44027035	After he said this , Paul took some bread and thanked God for it before all of them . He broke off a piece and began eating .
44027036	They all felt better and started eating , too .
44027037	There were two hundred seventy-six people on the ship .
44027038	When they had eaten all they wanted , they began making the ship lighter by throwing the grain into the sea .
44027039	When daylight came , the sailors saw land . They did not know what land it was , but they saw a bay with a beach and wanted to sail the ship to the beach if they could .
44027040	So they cut the ropes to the anchors and left the anchors in the sea . At the same time , they untied the ropes that were holding the rudders . Then they raised the front sail into the wind and sailed toward the beach .
44027041	But the ship hit a sandbank . The front of the ship stuck there and could not move , but the back of the ship began to break up from the big waves .
44027042	The soldiers decided to kill the prisoners so none of them could swim away and escape .
44027043	But Julius , the officer , wanted to let Paul live and did not allow the soldiers to kill the prisoners . Instead he ordered everyone who could swim to jump into the water first and swim to land .
44027044	The rest were to follow using wooden boards or pieces of the ship . And this is how all the people made it safely to land .
44028001	When we were safe on land , we learned that the island was called Malta .
44028002	The people who lived there were very good to us . Because it was raining and very cold , they made a fire and welcomed all of us .
44028003	Paul gathered a pile of sticks and was putting them on the fire when a poisonous snake came out because of the heat and bit him on the hand .
44028004	The people living on the island saw the snake hanging from Paul’s hand and said to each other , “ This man must be a murderer ! He did not die in the sea , but Justice does not want him to live . ”
44028005	But Paul shook the snake off into the fire and was not hurt .
44028006	The people thought that Paul would swell up or fall down dead . They waited and watched him for a long time , but nothing bad happened to him . So they changed their minds and said , “ He is a god ! ”
44028007	There were some fields around there owned by Publius , an important man on the island . He welcomed us into his home and was very good to us for three days .
44028008	Publius’ father was sick with a fever and dysentery . Paul went to him , prayed , and put his hands on the man and healed him .
44028009	After this , all the other sick people on the island came to Paul , and he healed them , too .
44028012	We stopped at Syracuse for three days .
44028013	From there we sailed to Rhegium . The next day a wind began to blow from the south , and a day later we came to Puteoli .
44028014	We found some believers there who asked us to stay with them for a week . Finally , we came to Rome .
44028015	The believers in Rome heard that we were there and came out as far as the Market of Appius and the Three Inns to meet us . When Paul saw them , he was encouraged and thanked God .
44028016	When we arrived at Rome , Paul was allowed to live alone , with the soldier who guarded him .
44028017	Three days later Paul sent for the leaders there . When they came together , he said , “ Brothers , I have done nothing against our people or the customs of our ancestors . But I was arrested in Jerusalem and given to the Romans .
44028018	After they asked me many questions , they could find no reason why I should be killed . They wanted to let me go free ,
44028019	but the evil people there argued against that . So I had to ask to come to Rome to have my trial before Caesar . But I have no charge to bring against my own people .
44028020	That is why I wanted to see you and talk with you . I am bound with this chain because I believe in the hope of Israel . ”
44028021	They answered Paul , “ We have received no letters from Judea about you . None of our Jewish brothers who have come from there brought news or told us anything bad about you .
44028022	But we want to hear your ideas , because we know that people everywhere are speaking against this religious group . ”
44028023	Paul and the people chose a day for a meeting and on that day many more of the Jews met with Paul at the place he was staying . He spoke to them all day long . Using the law of Moses and the prophets’ writings , he explained the kingdom of God , and he tried to persuade them to believe these things about Jesus .
44028024	Some believed what Paul said , but others did not .
44028025	So they argued and began leaving after Paul said one more thing to them : “ The Holy Spirit spoke the truth to your ancestors through Isaiah the prophet , saying ,
44028026	‘ Go to this people and say : You will listen and listen , but you will not understand . You will look and look , but you will not learn ,
44028027	because these people have become stubborn . They don’t hear with their ears , and they have closed their eyes . Otherwise , they might really understand what they see with their eyes and hear with their ears . They might really understand in their minds and come back to me and be healed . ’
44028028	“ I want you to know that God has also sent his salvation to all nations , and they will listen ! ” [
44028029	After Paul said this , the Jews left . They were arguing very much with each other . ]
44028030	Paul stayed two full years in his own rented house and welcomed all people who came to visit him .
44028031	He boldly preached about the kingdom of God and taught about the Lord Jesus Christ , and no one stopped him .
45001001	From Paul , a servant of Christ Jesus . God called me to be an apostle and chose me to tell the Good News .
45001002	God promised this Good News long ago through his prophets , as it is written in the Holy Scriptures .
45001005	Through Christ , God gave me the special work of an apostle , which was to lead people of all nations to believe and obey . I do this work for him .
45001006	And you who are in Rome are also called to belong to Jesus Christ .
45001007	To all of you in Rome whom God loves and has called to be his holy people : Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
45001008	First I want to say that I thank my God through Jesus Christ for all of you , because people everywhere in the world are talking about your faith .
45001009	God , whom I serve with my whole heart by telling the Good News about his Son , knows that I always mention you
45001010	every time I pray . I pray that I will be allowed to come to you , and this will happen if God wants it .
45001011	I want very much to see you , to give you some spiritual gift to make you strong .
45001012	I mean that I want us to help each other with the faith we have . Your faith will help me , and my faith will help you .
45001013	Brothers and sisters , I want you to know that I planned many times to come to you , but this has not been possible . I wanted to come so that I could help you grow spiritually as I have helped the other non-Jewish people .
45001014	I have a duty to all people — Greeks and those who are not Greeks , the wise and the foolish .
45001015	That is why I want so much to preach the Good News to you in Rome .
45001016	I am not ashamed of the Good News , because it is the power God uses to save everyone who believes — to save the Jews first , and then to save non-Jews .
45001017	The Good News shows how God makes people right with himself — that it begins and ends with faith . As the Scripture says , “ But those who are right with God will live by faith . ”
45001018	God’s anger is shown from heaven against all the evil and wrong things people do . By their own evil lives they hide the truth .
45001019	God shows his anger because some knowledge of him has been made clear to them . Yes , God has shown himself to them .
45001020	There are things about him that people cannot see — his eternal power and all the things that make him God . But since the beginning of the world those things have been easy to understand by what God has made . So people have no excuse for the bad things they do .
45001021	They knew God , but they did not give glory to God or thank him . Their thinking became useless . Their foolish minds were filled with darkness .
45001022	They said they were wise , but they became fools .
45001023	They traded the glory of God who lives forever for the worship of idols made to look like earthly people , birds , animals , and snakes .
45001024	Because they did these things , God left them and let them go their sinful way , wanting only to do evil . As a result , they became full of sexual sin , using their bodies wrongly with each other .
45001025	They traded the truth of God for a lie . They worshiped and served what had been created instead of the God who created those things , who should be praised forever . Amen .
45001026	Because people did those things , God left them and let them do the shameful things they wanted to do . Women stopped having natural sex and started having sex with other women .
45001027	In the same way , men stopped having natural sex and began wanting each other . Men did shameful things with other men , and in their bodies they received the punishment for those wrongs .
45001028	People did not think it was important to have a true knowledge of God . So God left them and allowed them to have their own worthless thinking and to do things they should not do .
45001029	They are filled with every kind of sin , evil , selfishness , and hatred . They are full of jealousy , murder , fighting , lying , and thinking the worst about each other . They gossip
45001030	and say evil things about each other . They hate God . They are rude and conceited and brag about themselves . They invent ways of doing evil . They do not obey their parents .
45001031	They are foolish , they do not keep their promises , and they show no kindness or mercy to others .
45001032	They know God’s law says that those who live like this should die . But they themselves not only continue to do these evil things , they applaud others who do them .
45002001	If you think you can judge others , you are wrong . When you judge them , you are really judging yourself guilty , because you do the same things they do .
45002002	God judges those who do wrong things , and we know that his judging is right .
45002003	You judge those who do wrong , but you do wrong yourselves . Do you think you will be able to escape the judgment of God ?
45002004	He has been very kind and patient , waiting for you to change , but you think nothing of his kindness . Perhaps you do not understand that God is kind to you so you will change your hearts and lives .
45002005	But you are stubborn and refuse to change , so you are making your own punishment even greater on the day he shows his anger . On that day everyone will see God’s right judgments .
45002006	God will reward or punish every person for what that person has done .
45002007	Some people , by always continuing to do good , live for God’s glory , for honor , and for life that has no end . God will give them life forever .
45002008	But other people are selfish . They refuse to follow truth and , instead , follow evil . God will give them his punishment and anger .
45002009	He will give trouble and suffering to everyone who does evil — to the Jews first and also to those who are not Jews .
45002010	But he will give glory , honor , and peace to everyone who does good — to the Jews first and also to those who are not Jews .
45002011	For God judges all people in the same way .
45002012	People who do not have the law and who are sinners will be lost , although they do not have the law . And , in the same way , those who have the law and are sinners will be judged by the law .
45002013	Hearing the law does not make people right with God . It is those who obey the law who will be right with him .
45002014	( Those who are not Jews do not have the law , but when they freely do what the law commands , they are the law for themselves . This is true even though they do not have the law .
45002015	They show that in their hearts they know what is right and wrong , just as the law commands . And they show this by their consciences . Sometimes their thoughts tell them they did wrong , and sometimes their thoughts tell them they did right . )
45002016	All these things will happen on the day when God , through Christ Jesus , will judge people’s secret thoughts . The Good News that I preach says this .
45002017	What about you ? You call yourself a Jew . You trust in the law of Moses and brag that you are close to God .
45002018	You know what he wants you to do and what is important , because you have learned the law .
45002019	You think you are a guide for the blind and a light for those who are in darkness .
45002020	You think you can show foolish people what is right and teach those who know nothing . You have the law ; so you think you know everything and have all truth .
45002021	You teach others , so why don’t you teach yourself ? You tell others not to steal , but you steal .
45002022	You say that others must not take part in adultery , but you are guilty of that sin . You hate idols , but you steal from temples .
45002023	You brag about having God’s law , but you bring shame to God by breaking his law ,
45002024	just as the Scriptures say : “ Those who are not Jews speak against God’s name because of you . ”
45002025	If you follow the law , your circumcision has meaning . But if you break the law , it is as if you were never circumcised .
45002026	People who are not Jews are not circumcised , but if they do what the law says , it is as if they were circumcised .
45002027	You Jews have the written law and circumcision , but you break the law . So those who are not circumcised in their bodies , but still obey the law , will show that you are guilty .
45002028	They can do this because a person is not a true Jew if he is only a Jew in his physical body ; true circumcision is not only on the outside of the body .
45002029	A person is a Jew only if he is a Jew inside ; true circumcision is done in the heart by the Spirit , not by the written law . Such a person gets praise from God rather than from people .
45003001	So , do Jews have anything that other people do not have ? Is there anything special about being circumcised ?
45003002	Yes , of course , there is in every way . The most important thing is this : God trusted the Jews with his teachings .
45003003	If some Jews were not faithful to him , will that stop God from doing what he promised ?
45003004	No ! God will continue to be true even when every person is false . As the Scriptures say : “ So you will be shown to be right when you speak , and you will win your case . ”
45003005	When we do wrong , that shows more clearly that God is right . So can we say that God is wrong to punish us ? ( I am talking as people might talk . )
45003006	No ! If God could not punish us , he could not judge the world .
45003007	A person might say , “ When I lie , it really gives him glory , because my lie shows God’s truth . So why am I judged a sinner ? ”
45003008	It would be the same to say , “ We should do evil so that good will come . ” Some people find fault with us and say we teach this , but they are wrong and deserve the punishment they will receive .
45003009	So are we Jews better than others ? No ! We have already said that Jews and those who are not Jews are all guilty of sin .
45003010	As the Scriptures say : “ There is no one who always does what is right , not even one .
45003011	There is no one who understands . There is no one who looks to God for help .
45003012	All have turned away . Together , everyone has become useless . There is no one who does anything good ; there is not even one . ”
45003013	“ Their throats are like open graves ; they use their tongues for telling lies . ” “ Their words are like snake poison . ”
45003014	“ Their mouths are full of cursing and hate . ”
